job_title: RN Surgery in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Quickapply via Indeed, called for screening with recruiter who was extremely transparent without having to ask questions such as compensation, benefits, etc. Scheduled in-person interview which was very candid and non-scripted. Felt extremely comfortable and "home". Again, very transparent and forthright. The onboarding process was the most organized and seamless I have ever experienced. All done same day, same room, with a very cohesive team of nurses, HR and other staff.
cons: None. The care as a patient received has been excellent and the staff are truly welcoming and exceptional.

job_title: Nurse Technician in Palm Coast, FL
pros: The unit works as a team to support each other and the managers are helpful with concerns.
cons: Focuses more on surveys than the actual care of patients

job_title: Nurse Tech in Palm Coast, FL
pros: I absolutely loved working for this company! They make sure their employees have a great work-life balance. I never felt overwhelmed working during my shifts.
cons: Being on-call, potentially being called in for work later than one may expect; I called into work right around noon or so and didn’t make until 2, so my shift was like 5 hours

job_title: Medical Assistant/Phlebotomist in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Great coworkers and good benefits
cons: A lot of travel contract employees

job_title: EVS Attendant in Palm Coast, FL
pros: I believe that the work environment is very positive
cons: As long as everyone work together and help those who are in need I don't believe there is a downside to working there.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Young, but eager coworkers. Good leadership on the floor.
cons: Young ER doctors straight out of residency. ER training is focused on corporate dictated training, not department specific.

job_title: Operations Specialist in Palm Coast, FL
pros:
Amazing pay and great benefits

Get to work with some wonderful and amazing healthcare workers who love their job and are always ready to help you at a moment's notice! 

Freedom of religion and diversity
cons:
1. Vaccine mandates are forced, or you will be terminated. Vaccines are strongly taught and encouraged as highly safe and effective - but! you have to sign a waiver in case you have side effects, long-term health issues, or death. Masks are still worn because you can still spread Covid and contract it yourself (even after full vaccination). Holy contradiction, Batman! 

2. Must have good people skills and be "thick-skinned" - working with some nasty attitudes, insecure, rude, narcissistic, gossiping, and backstabbing healthcare workers who are ungrateful for having a good-paying job. Note: This goes with any company or job when working with others.

job_title: Remote Customer Service Representative in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Everyone was amazing in communications, and assisting throughout the entire new hire process leading up to my start date.
cons: Onboarding for this area is at Fish Hospital which was a 70 mile drive (however it was worth it in the long run).

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Palm Coast, FL
pros:
Work-family
Leadership
Fast-paced
Accommodating
Learning-environment
cons:
Stressing workloads
Low pay
Mental tiredness

job_title: Registered Nurse in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Pay is ok. Lots of overtime to be had. Most (but not all) of the staff are caring and very nice people.
cons:
The Senior Nurse Manager is not qualified to be in her position. She shows lots of favoritism toward certain employees - even those who are poor performers and/or talk very badly about her behind her back. She is clueless as to what is really happening on the unit. She listens to her minions, and neglects to investigate what is really happening. She also fails to hold poor performers accountable, which leaves the high performing, hard workers being taxed with picking up the slack while the poor performers continue to abuse the system.
Poor communication with employees. Does not respond to emails or texts for weeks. Promises one thing, and then goes back on her word. 
Very poor processes in place. Most of the Charge Nurses are lazy, and sit at the desk rather than help out on the unit. There are many nurses who have difficulty providing patient care without lots of assistance. It is very concerning.

job_title: Central Scheduler in Palm Coast, FL
pros: I have had a great experience with on boarding and applying. The interviewers were kind. Employee health were excellent. Thanks so much for this opportunity.
cons: No cons at this time.

job_title: Central Scheduling in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Having the opportunity to continue on my track of providing exceptional patient service, and now remotely, being a part of a TEAM that together we will accomplish much for our patients, providers and our company (Advent)
cons: N/A I’m a new hire

cons: Good staff leave because they find incentives at other hospitals

Great work environment

job_title: Dietary in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Pay, Benefits. Hours, Patients, Education you receive.
cons: Management plays a lot of favoritism. Allows employees to talk down to other employees, Staff in kitchen and Management are racists. Heard a lot racist remarks being made. Who is Supervising employees or Supervisors. They did have a really awesome Supervisor named Monica. She kept everyone in-line and made it a pleasant workplace. Unfortunately when she left it went downhill. Human Resources really needs to look into what’s going on .

job_title: Lead Medical Technologist in Palm Coast, FL
pros: AdventHealth Palm Coast is a faith based organization without being sanctimonious. The Laboratory offers great flexibility in hours worked and days off. Many benefits are available.
cons: The cost of some benefits are high, but negligible compared to what AHPC is covering for you.

Each department helps the other. No turf wars 
The facility is truly Faith based. But not pious
cons: Benefits are a bit more expensive than my previous organization

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Palm Coast, FL

review_title: Budget cuts, budget cuts, budget cuts!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great teamwork on my floor if the right people are working. Easy self-scheduling.
cons:
High staff ratios. 7-1 Med Surg, 5-1 PCU, 2-3 ICU. Management does not care if the patients are high acuity. If census is low, they will send home your tech and possibly a nurse and leave you with an even heavier load. 

More things are expected of us every week. They pile on more and more but yet keep the same staff ratios and pay.

There are some really nice people, but some really rude people too. I guess that's healthcare.

Lowest pay I've ever encountered. There is no opportunity for overtime. You will get placed on call every other week which uses your PDO and you won't have any left for actual vacation.

SO many other reasons. Just don't work here.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Palm Coast, FL
pros: I work with a fabulous group of nurses. Self scheduling is honored. The Palm Coast area is beautiful! Generous sign on bonus (see below).
cons: Benefits are mediocre at best.  I find interdisciplinary respect and communication to be severely lacking particularly between physicians and nurses.  This has been very challenging for me, as I'm used to pleasant, informative  interactions with physicians and other providers.  Staffing is horrendous!  The nurses (no CNA's! are great, but no one has time to help anyone else. But be sure you document our Q2 hour turns, and your hourly rounds.) I believed that by moving to a beachside town I'd be struggling to find a position. Not so! In fact, the above mentioned sign on bonus, while quite generous, should have been a red flag!  Buyer beware. You'll work extra hard here and  leave in tears.! I am moving on, thankfully!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Close to home. Clean well maintained building.
cons:
Extremely short staffed. The Hospital is controlled by the Seventh Day Adventist boys club so if you are female and want to be in management forget it.
The pay is on the low side for the amount of work the short staffed nurses get dumped on them.
On your day off, 9 times out of 10 you will be called in to work......you better not refuse.
Many unqualified nurses working- can't read EKG's or drop NG tubes without help.
This has to be one of the most backward, butt kissing place I have ever worked. Glad I'm gone.

job_title: RN CDI in Flagler Beach, FL
pros: The Whole Care Experience flows into my everyday life.   I am treated with respect, kindness, and gratitude daily at my job.
cons:
I wish we had an onsite area to exercise.  Some examples:

A small room to do brief yoga, meditation,  stretch and bring a wholeness to the body mind and soul.  It would be great to have this accessible to employees throughout the day.  

More engagement with our community exercise facilities.  Presently we are only associated with Fitness One.   I have many friends that get a discount at various Gyms in our area.

review_title: Enjoy going to work each day
job_title: Mid-Level Clerical in Palm Coast, FL
pros:
- Supportive direct team
- Training and job shadowing available
- Excellent Mission, Vision, and Values
- Visible effort from some of the leadership for positive change
- Ability to share opinion without retaliation
cons:
- Managers are unseasoned and although they have training available, they don't have time or one-on-one support to learn how to be a good manager
- Too many initiatives instead of focusing solely on patient care and employee engagement (work can get overwhelming)
-  Executive Leadership is unsupportive (except Wally and Corey - they're great)
-  Health Benefits are incredibly expensive
-  No Wellness facility for employees

job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Very busy, fast paced hospital. Lots of good experience to be gained in critical care.
cons: High turnover in staff and management. This company is not nice. They have the appearance of being a faith based system, but they only worship the almighty dollar. It's all about numbers, patient care is secondary to satisfaction and speed. Putting patents in beds in the hallway to get them out of the waiting room, meanwhile there is no nurse assigned to the patient because they are all maxed is not safe care.  I'm feeling overwhelmed with the new way they are running this department. All of the experienced nurses are quitting, lots of new grads.  Insurance is terrible.

review_title: The poor community perception of this facility is there for a reason...
job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Flagler Beach, FL
pros: Close to home. Decent coworkers who are all in the same situation together. Not much else I could say for pros.
cons:
-Disconnected management/directors/leadership. 
-Not enough staffing.
-Poor pay.
-High "satisfaction" scores from patients are more important that the morale of employees. Most of the high satisfaction scores go to the physicians who routinely prescribe pain meds. Those who do not are ranked lower. Patients know which doctors give them pain meds freely and ask for them by name, and will leave if they are not available.
-Read the fine print if they offer a sign on bonus.
-High turnover. Senior/seasoned nurses are fired for speaking up on issues that are unsafe for staff and patients and replaced with new grads.
-No representation for staff. Non Union and HR works for the company, not the employees.

job_title: RN Leader in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Nice facility, clean. Most employees friendly. Best known for ortho in community. Only hospital in Flagler county. Slow in summer months be prepared to be sent home some.
cons: Low Pay. Lack of recognition. Do as I say not as I do. Toxic atmosphere. Very high turnover for staff and leaders in all departments. Working short and stretched most of the time. More rooms do not equal more staff, do not be fooled in the interview. There's a reason for a $10k sign on.

job_title: Secretry in Palm Coast, FL
pros: I’ve worked for Florida Hospital for 15+ years in multiple capacities.  Our organization continually educates it’s employees on how they are expected to treat patients, fellow staff members, and the community - in a loving, caring, compassionate way.  We collaborate and work together to find ways to improve our services and to provide better outcomes.  Florida hospital has adopted a “Whole Care” philosophy striving to make all who enter it’s doors feel loved, cared about, respected and safe. Our environment is clean and welcoming, and we try and have fun at work, while providing excellent care to our patients and their families. My coworkers are like my family.  We care about each other and the care that we provide.
cons: Employees need to be able to trust their managers and need to be able to speak with them in confidence if they are having an issue, without fear of retribution or having HR called in to witness a conversation. Employees need to feel that their managers “have their back” so to speak and they need to feel supported. They need managers who are approachable, who listen when they are approached, and who truly care about their concerns.  They also need to feel appreciated and need to feel like their efforts are recognized. Once they have proven themselves, they need to feel that there are opportunities for advancement within the organization.  Florida Hospital is very "degree" oriented. They don't consider longevity and experience as valuable as a degree when they are promoting their employees.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Coast, FL
pros: Good work environment, most people have pretty good attitudes. The company shows they care about all employees in ways such as yearly compensation, small holiday appreciation, and lunch ins.
cons: Depending on which department you are in you may not be treated as fairly as you should be from department managers as well as getting the pay that you deserve can be a issue.

review_title: Make sure your good with following the sda rules. Don't let them know what your religion is.
